intro: Peucedanum dubium, commonly known as the European cowparsley, is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Peucedanum dubium is typically found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, growing in temperate climates.
